areasOfStudy.name: What is the role of nucleic acids and proteins in maintaining life?

topics.name: Nucleic Acids
topics.subtitle: DNA and RNA structure
dotPoints: The structure of nucleotides and their role as the monomers of nucleic acids
The structure of DNA and RNA including the double helix model
The role of complementary base pairing in DNA replication

topics.name: Proteins
topics.subtitle: Structure and function
dotPoints: The structure of amino acids and their role as the monomers of polypeptides
The four levels of protein structure: primary, secondary, tertiary and quaternary
The relationship between protein structure and function

topics.name: Gene Expression
topics.subtitle: Transcription and translation
dotPoints: The process of transcription including the role of RNA polymerase
The process of translation including the role of ribosomes, mRNA, tRNA and amino acids
The genetic code including codons and anticodons

topics.name: Gene Regulation
topics.subtitle: Control of gene expression
dotPoints: The regulatory mechanisms that control gene expression in prokaryotes and eukaryotes
The role of transcription factors and regulatory sequences
Epigenetic modifications including DNA methylation

topics.name: Core Technologies
topics.subtitle: PCR and gel electrophoresis
dotPoints: The use of polymerase chain reaction (PCR) to amplify DNA
The use of gel electrophoresis to separate DNA fragments
DNA profiling and its applications

topics.name: Genetic Modification
topics.subtitle: GMOs and transgenics
dotPoints: The production of genetically modified organisms (GMOs)
The differences between transgenic, cisgenic and gene-edited organisms
The implications of genetic modification for agriculture and medicine

topics.name: Gene Cloning
topics.subtitle: Vectors and transformation
dotPoints: The use of restriction enzymes and ligases in gene cloning
The role of vectors including plasmids in gene cloning
The process of bacterial transformation

topics.name: Gene Editing
topics.subtitle: CRISPR-Cas9 system
dotPoints: The mechanism of CRISPR-Cas9 gene editing
The applications of gene editing in research and medicine
The ethical considerations of gene editing technologies

topics.name: Metabolism
topics.subtitle: Anabolic and catabolic reactions
dotPoints: The general structure of biochemical pathways in photosynthesis and cellular respiration
The distinction between anabolic and catabolic reactions

topics.name: Catalysts
topics.subtitle: Enzymes and coenzymes
dotPoints: The role of enzymes and coenzymes in facilitating steps in photosynthesis and cellular respiration
The structure and function of ATP as a coenzyme

topics.name: Enzyme Activity
topics.subtitle: Factors affecting rate
dotPoints: Factors that impact enzyme function: temperature, pH, concentration
Competitive and non-competitive enzyme inhibitors

topics.name: Chloroplasts
topics.subtitle: Structure and function
dotPoints: The structure of chloroplasts including thylakoids, grana and stroma
The locations of light dependent and light independent reactions

topics.name: Photosynthesis
topics.subtitle: Light and dark reactions
dotPoints: The inputs and outputs of light dependent and light independent stages
The role of chlorophyll in capturing light energy

topics.name: Plant Adaptations
topics.subtitle: C3, C4 and CAM plants
dotPoints: The role of Rubisco in photosynthesis
Adaptations of C3, C4 and CAM plants to maximise photosynthetic efficiency

topics.name: Mitochondria
topics.subtitle: Structure and function
dotPoints: The structure of mitochondria including cristae and matrix
The locations of glycolysis, Krebs cycle and electron transport chain

topics.name: Cell Respiration
topics.subtitle: Aerobic respiration stages
dotPoints: The main inputs, outputs and locations of glycolysis, Krebs cycle and electron transport chain
ATP yield from aerobic respiration

topics.name: Fermentation
topics.subtitle: Anaerobic pathways
dotPoints: The location, inputs and outputs of anaerobic fermentation in animals and yeasts
Applications of anaerobic fermentation for biofuel production

units.name: How does life change and respond to challenges?

areasOfStudy.name: How do organisms respond to pathogens?

topics.name: Pathogens
topics.subtitle: Cellular and non-cellular
dotPoints: The characteristics of cellular and non-cellular pathogens
The difference between antigens, self-antigens and allergens

topics.name: Surface Barriers
topics.subtitle: First line of defence
dotPoints: Physical, chemical and microbiota barriers to infection
Plant surface barriers

topics.name: Leukocytes
topics.subtitle: White blood cells
dotPoints: The role of leukocytes in the immune response
Types of leukocytes including phagocytes and lymphocytes

topics.name: Innate Immunity
topics.subtitle: Second line of defence
dotPoints: The role of inflammation, complement proteins and interferons
The process of phagocytosis

topics.name: Lymphatic System
topics.subtitle: Lymph nodes and vessels
dotPoints: The structure and function of the lymphatic system
The role of lymph nodes in immune responses

topics.name: Adaptive Immunity
topics.subtitle: Third line of defence
dotPoints: The difference between humoral and cell-mediated immunity
The role of B cells and T cells in adaptive immunity
The structure and function of antibodies

topics.name: Types of Immunity
topics.subtitle: Active and passive immunity
dotPoints: The difference between active and passive immunity
The difference between natural and artificial immunity
Immunological memory and the role of memory cells

topics.name: Disease Spread
topics.subtitle: Outbreaks and epidemics
dotPoints: The definition of outbreak, epidemic and pandemic
Factors that influence the spread of disease

topics.name: Disease Control
topics.subtitle: Scientific and social strategies
dotPoints: Scientific strategies for disease control
Social strategies for disease control

topics.name: Vaccination
topics.subtitle: Types and mechanisms
dotPoints: How vaccines work to provide immunity

The eradication of smallpox as a case study

topics.name: Immunotherapy
topics.subtitle: Monoclonal antibodies
